description: Write scenarios in plain English with concrete, real values. Use actual constants where known, not placeholders. Describe stub return values explicitly. Every scenario with Given/When/Then MUST include examples table with actual data.

do.description: Plain English scenarios with concrete values, actual constants, explicit stub descriptions, and required examples.

example: Given user has typed request message 'start shaping'
Then AI Chat identifies story shaping keywords
Given user has attached documents to chat window
And user has typed request message 'start shaping'

guidance.description: Always include examples table with actual data for every scenario that has Given/When/Then steps
Use actual constants for fixed paths and structures
Describe stub return values explicitly in Givens
example: Given Payment validators are stubbed to return:

guidance.description: Use actual class names and file paths
example: (Real class names and paths, not placeholders)

dont.description: Don't use variables/placeholders, don't omit examples, don't parameterize constants or hide stub behavior.

example: Given user has typed request message '<request_message>' (WRONG - has variable)
CORRECT: Given user has typed request message 'start shaping'

guidance.description: Don't omit examples when scenarios have steps
example: Given user has typed request message 'start shaping'

guidance.description: Don't parameterize inputs that are stubbed
example: Given Payment data '{payment_data}' And validators are stubbed
If validators are stubbed, the input data is irrelevant
Given Payment validators are configured (WRONG - doesn't show what stubs return)
CORRECT: Given Payment validators are stubbed to return '{...actual JSON...}'
